channel.title: Adding items to your rsps! help
channel.description:
I need help adding downloaded items such as torva and capes etc. i've searched for about an hour and i didn't understand really well, if someone could help me out and explain in detail or better yet add me on skype it would be very much appreciated !!
Skype: helloitsmecam
[b]Thank you please help!![/b]

item.title: Adding items to your rsps! help
item.dc:creator: @shuttlebutt shuttlebutt
item.description:
@shuttlebutt wrote:

nolan2131:

It shouldn’t be. If you’re using PI, it will be located within the client files.

how do i check what base it is for myself? the place i got it from said it was PI

[EDIT]
It’s a PI i just found out how to check and yep

Read full topic
item.source: Adding items to your rsps! help

item.title: Adding items to your rsps! help
item.dc:creator: @shuttlebutt shuttlebutt
item.description:
@shuttlebutt wrote:

[quote=“nolan2131, post:12, topic:535810”][quote author=Bl3nd link=topic=654619.msg4384595#msg4384595 date=1384842590]

Ok, first find the model you wish to add to your source, such as the one below.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/models/494344-rel-pi-my-first-recolour-items-wings-rel-pi.html

Download the .dat file and throw it into the models folder in your cache.

Then take the ints that are provided within the thread and add them into your itemdef.java located within your client files.

Compile, enjoy

this. Lol right as I was writing what you just said.
[/quote]

:P, Also as I’m sure you already know the item id to spawn your custom is located within the int @ if(i == 20073) for example. For future references I would recommend only messing with models that come with ints, it’s the best way for beginners. Some people release models without ints and it can be difficult to work with if you don’t know what you’re doing. Good Luck[/quote]
that was the problem at first, i downloaded one without ints, thank you for your help much appreciated !

Read full topic
item.source: Adding items to your rsps! help

item.title: Adding items to your rsps! help
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“Bl3nd, post:10, topic:535810”][quote author=nolan2131 link=topic=654619.msg4384594#msg4384594 date=1384842459]
Ok, first find the model you wish to add to your source, such as the one below.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/models/494344-rel-pi-my-first-recolour-items-wings-rel-pi.html

Download the .dat file and throw it into the models folder in your cache.

Then take the ints that are provided within the thread and add them into your itemdef.java located within your client files.

Compile, enjoy
[/quote]

this. Lol right as I was writing what you just said.[/quote]

:P, Also as I’m sure you already know the item id to spawn your custom is located within the int @ if(i == 20073) for example. For future references I would recommend only messing with models that come with ints, it’s the best way for beginners. Some people release models without ints and it can be difficult to work with if you don’t know what you’re doing. Good Luck

[quote=“shuttlebutt, post:11, topic:535810”][quote author=nolan2131 link=topic=654619.msg4384594#msg4384594 date=1384842459]
Ok, first find the model you wish to add to your source, such as the one below.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/models/494344-rel-pi-my-first-recolour-items-wings-rel-pi.html

Download the .dat file and throw it into the models folder in your cache.

Then take the ints that are provided within the thread and add them into your itemdef.java located within your client files.

Compile, enjoy
[/quote]
I cannot find the itemdef.java i think i may not have it ?[/quote]

Are you looking in the client?

Read full topic
